imgs.text: Columbia 29 Mk I photo on sailboatdata.com

name: COLUMBIA 29 MKI
notes:
(S&S #1501)
(It is thought that this was the first boat called 'Columbia'. The original mold and first hulls were built independently - 1960?, and only later purchased by the company that became Columbia Yachts). 
In any case, the COLUMBIA 29 was the first boat built by Glas Laminates and one of its most successful models.
A raised deck version was introduced in 1963 called the COLUMBIA 29 DEFENDER.
In 1965 there was a styling change with a new more streamlined deck and coachroof. (COLUMBIA 29 MKII).
Delivered with outboard well or optional gas inboard engine.
